news.title: 格陵兰主权争夺战升级！特朗普关税大棒砸向欧洲盟友？
伊朗最高领袖首次承认抗议致数千人死亡
news.title0: Iran supreme leader acknowledges thousands killed during recent protests
news.content: 伊朗最高领袖哈梅内伊首次公开承认，近期抗议活动中有数千人丧生，并将责任归咎于美国。
news.content0: Iran's supreme leader has for the first time publicly acknowledged that thousands of people were killed during recent protests.In a speech on Saturday, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said thousands had been killed, "some in an inhuman, savage manner", and blamed the US for the deaths.A violent response to the unrest has claimed 3,090 lives, according to US-based Iranian Human Rights Activists News Agency (HRANA), with some activist groups putting the death toll far higher. An internet blackout has made it extremely difficult to get clear information.US PresidentDonald Trump recently urged Iranian demonstrators to "keep protesting" and threatened military intervention if security forces kill them.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 格陵兰与丹麦爆发抗议，反对特朗普收购计划
news.title0: Protests in Greenland and Denmark against Trump plans
news.content: 格陵兰和丹麦数千人抗议特朗普收购格陵兰的计划，特朗普威胁对反对其计划的欧洲国家加征关税。
news.content0: Thousands of people in Greenland and Denmark have protested against plans by US President Donald Trump to take over Greenland - an autonomous Danish territory.Demonstrations were held in Danish cities including the capital, Copenhagen, as well as in Greenland's capital, Nuuk.The rallies coincide with a visit to Copenhagen by a delegation from the US Congress. Its leader, Democratic Senator Chris Coons, described Mr Trump's rhetoric as "not constructive".Mr Trump has not ruled out taking Greenland, which he insists is critical for America's national security, by force - and has now announced he will impose tariffs European countries that are opposed to his plan.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 加拿大与华达成协议，削减电动汽车关税
news.title0: Canada's deal with China signals it is serious about shift from US
news.content: 加拿大宣布降低部分中国电动汽车关税，以换取中国降低对加拿大农产品的关税，此举被视为对美政策调整。
news.content0: Prime Minister Mark Carney's new approach to Canada's foreign policy can perhaps be distilled in one line: "We take the world as it is, not as we wish it to be."That was his response when asked about the deal struck with China on Friday, despite concerns over its human rights record and nearly a year after he called China "the biggest security threat" facing Canada.The deal will see Canada ease tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles that it imposed in tandem with the US in 2024. In exchange, China will lower retaliatory tariffs on key Canadian agricultural products.Experts told the BBC the move represents a significant shift in Canada's policy on China, one that is shaped by ongoing uncertainty with the US, its largest trade partner."The prime minister is saying, essentially, that Canada has agency too, and that it's not going to just sit and wait for the United States," said Eric Miller, a Washington DC based trade adviser and president of the Rideau Potomac Strategy Group.China and Canada announce tariffs relief after high-stakes meetingCarney faces delicate balancing act in China visitFour things the US wants from Canada on trade
news.author: BBC

news.title: 美法官限制ICE对明尼阿波利斯抗议者使用武力
news.title0: US judge restricts ICE response to Minneapolis protesters
news.content: 美国联邦法官下令限制移民海关执法局对明尼阿波利斯“和平”抗议者使用逮捕和胡椒喷雾等战术。
news.content0: A US federal judge has issued an order limiting the crowd control tactics that can be used by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents (ICE) towards "peaceful and unobstructive" protesters in Minneapolis.Judge Katherine Menendez ruled on Friday night that federal agents can't arrest or pepper spray peaceful demonstrators, including those monitoring and observing ICE agents.The ruling comes ahead of planned weekend protests against the widespread immigration action in the city and follows the fatal shooting of Renee Good by an ICE agent earlier this month.The US Department of Homeland Security said it is taking measures to protect officers from rioters.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 瑞士酒吧火灾遇难者家属称员工未受安全培训
news.title0: Swiss bar employee who reportedly held sparkler unaware of dangers, family says
news.content: 瑞士酒吧致命火灾中遇难的员工家属称，其未接受安全培训，不知天花板易燃风险。酒吧老板被控过失杀人。
news.content0: A staff member who was working at the Swiss bar where a deadly fire broke out on New Year's Eve received no safety training and was unaware of the danger posed by the ceiling that caught alight, her family's lawyerhas alleged.Cyane Panine, 24, died in the fire at Le Constellation bar in Crans Montana and was widely identified in a video wearing a helmet and holding a champagne bottle with a sparkler attached when the ceiling caught fire.The bar's French owners, Jacques and Jessica Moretti, have been accused by authorities of manslaughter by negligence, bodily harm by negligence and arson by negligence.Forty people were killed and 116 were injured in the blaze in southwest Switzerland.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 特朗普公布加沙“和平委员会”首批成员名单
news.title0: Big names on Trump's peace panel face huge challenges in Gaza
news.content: 白宫公布加沙“和平委员会”首批成员，包括库什纳、布莱尔等，被批缺乏巴勒斯坦代表，面临重建与和平巨大挑战。
news.content0: The White House has announced the first members of its Gaza "Board of Peace", and the list of names will do little to dispel the criticism from some quarters that the US president's plan resembles, at its heart, a colonial solution imposed over the heads of the Palestinians.There are still several unknowns - namely who else might be added, and the exact structure of what is currently a rather complicated layout.So far, no Palestinian names are included on the two separate senior boards that have been officially unveiled.One is a "founding Executive Board", with a high-level focus on investment and diplomacy. The other, called the "Gaza Executive Board", is responsible for overseeing all on-the-ground work of yet another administrative group, the National Committee for the Administration of Gaza (NCAG).That committee is made up of supposedly technocratic, apolitical Palestinians, led by Dr Ali Shaath, a civil engineer by training who's held ministerial positions in the Palestinian Authority.But of the seven members of the founding Executive Board, six are Americans - including US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and other members of Trump's inner circle like his son-in-law Jared Kushner, and Steve Witkoff, who is US Special Envoy to the Middle East, but also a friend of the president and a fellow real estate developer.
news.author: BBC

news.title: OpenAI将在免费版ChatGPT中测试广告
news.title0: ChatGPT to start showing users ads based on their conversations
news.content: OpenAI宣布将在免费版ChatGPT中测试基于对话的广告，并推出低价“Go”订阅层，以增加收入。
news.content0: ChatGPT may soon serve up ads for products it thinks you’d like to buy.
news.author: CNN

news.title: 印尼搜寻载有11人的失踪监视飞机
news.title0: Indonesia searching for missing surveillance plane with 11 on board
news.content: 印尼一架载有11人的渔业监视飞机在苏拉威西岛附近失联，救援人员正在展开搜索。
news.content0: Indonesianrescuers were searching on Saturday for an ATR 42-500 fisheries surveillance aircraft that went missing with 11 people on board, officials said.
news.author: CNN

news.title: 救援视频曝光委内瑞拉反对派领袖海上逃亡
news.title0: Video of Machado’s daring escape from Venezuela released by rescue team
news.content: 美国救援团队发布视频，展示其如何协助委内瑞拉反对派领袖马查多从海上逃离该国。
news.content0: The US-based rescue team Grey Bull has released a short video showing how they helped Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machadoescapethe country last month.
news.author: CNN
